arguments.name: Dark Mode Feature
arguments.description: Project to implement dark mode support in the application.

arguments.name: Implement Dark Mode
arguments.problem_statement: The app currently only supports light mode, which can be straining in low-light environments. We need to implement dark mode support that automatically adjusts UI elements for optimal readability and energy efficiency on OLED screens.
arguments.success_criteria: After implementation, users should be able to switch between light and dark modes seamlessly with a toggle in the settings menu. The dark mode should maintain consistent styling across all app components, reduce eye strain in low-light conditions, and pass accessibility tests.
arguments.description: Implement dark mode feature for the application.

results.task_name: Break down a feature into tasks

arguments.name: Implement User Notifications
arguments.problem_statement: Design and implement an end-to-end user notification system that supports multiple channels (email, SMS, in-app) triggered by workunit updates. The system should allow users to subscribe/unsubscribe, manage preferences, and log notifications for auditing purposes.
arguments.success_criteria: User can receive timely notifications via their preferred channel when a workunit is updated; notifications are logged and can be audited; the system supports subscription management with minimal latency.
arguments.description: This workunit covers all aspects of implementing user notifications including requirements analysis, design, API development, frontend integration, testing, documentation, and deployment.

arguments.title: Quarterly Audit Review
arguments.content: This workunit was reviewed during the quarterly audit and its current status (active) was confirmed.

arguments.name: Real-Time Notifications - WebSocket vs Polling Decision
arguments.problem_statement: We need to decide between using WebSockets and polling for our real-time notification feature. The team has decided to use WebSockets.
arguments.success_criteria: Document the decision, including tradeoffs considered (e.g., scalability, resource usage, latency) in a critical architectural decision note.
arguments.description: This workunit captures the critical architectural decision regarding the implementation of real-time notifications using WebSockets instead of polling. Tradeoffs include lower latency and reduced server load with WebSockets versus increased complexity in connection management and potential scaling challenges.

arguments.name: Real-Time Notification Feature
arguments.problem_statement: Implement a real-time notification system using WebSockets instead of polling.
arguments.success_criteria: Notifications are delivered in real time with minimal latency and the system scales well under load.
arguments.description: We decided to use WebSockets for our real-time notifications feature. This decision was made after evaluating tradeoffs between polling and WebSockets. Polling can be simpler but introduces unnecessary network overhead and delays, while WebSockets provide a persistent connection that reduces latency and improves scalability. However, WebSockets require more careful handling of connection management and error recovery. Overall, the benefits in responsiveness and efficiency outweighed the complexity.
